intro: Arrabidaea platyphylla var. stricta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved arrabidaea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
